meanings.definition: To obstruct by filling or blocking up
meanings.sent1: The fallen leaves can choke the drain and cause flooding.
meanings.sent2: I almost choked on a piece of apple.
meanings.sent3: Don't choke the bottle with too much ketchup!
meanings.sent4: Her tears seemed to choke the words in her throat.
meanings.sent5: The vines seemed to choke the life out of the old tree.

meanings.sent1: The tight collar made him choke during the speech.
meanings.sent2: She started to choke after inhaling the smoke.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to choke on its food for attention.
meanings.sent4: The thick smoke seemed to choke the air from his lungs.
meanings.sent5: The dust in the attic made her choke and cough uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: A device in a carburetor for enriching the fuel mixture by reducing the air supply
meanings.sent1: The mechanic adjusted the choke to start the engine smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The old car's choke needed to be replaced for better performance.
meanings.sent3: The choke in the carburetor was stuck, causing the engine to sputter.
meanings.sent4: The choke in the carburetor acted like a gatekeeper for the fuel.
meanings.sent5: The driver pulled out the choke to help the engine start on a cold morning.
